item.title: swc v1.2.11: Fix for almost all typescript bugs
item.guid: swc v1.2.11: Fix for almost all typescript bugs

item.title: v1.2: spack: Yet another asset bundler
item.guid: v1.2: spack: Yet another asset bundler

item.title: Why is swc fast?
item.description: swc is fast. Very fast. It's 18x faster than babel on a single-core benchmark, and on a parallel benchmark, it's 68x faster than babel on a 4 core (8 HT) machine. Why? Just because it's written in rust? No. Its fundamental design differs from any other tool.

item.title: Introducing pmutil
item.description: swc uses proc macros extensively. I use a procedural macro if possible to reduce boilerplates and to avoid rewriting boilerplates when something is changed. Behind the scene, there's a hero crate called pmutil. It provides useful stuffs for proc macros.
